titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cornwall Miscellanea 1779-2003 MS 011 MS 011 MS 011
titlestmt.author: Processed by Ryan Bachman

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-02-02 07:46:24 -0800.

did.abstract: This collection is comprised of assorted papers and photographs related to Cornwall residents.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The collection was begun by local historian E.C. Starr, and continued by later town historians and Cornwall Historical Society members such as Michael Gannett.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Cornwall Miscellanea; MS 011; box number; folder number; Cornwall Historical Society

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The collection was begun by local historian E.C. Starr and continued by later town historians and Cornwall Historical Society members such as Michael Gannett. Unlike other documents related to individuals and families from Cornwall, these items were not put into occupational categories and were collected mainly for genealogical purposes. Photographs were similarly collected mainly for genealogical purposes and include images related to local families and their homes, along with photographs associated with everyday life in the community.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This Cornwall Photographs and Miscellanea Collection is comprised of four series; photographic materials, people, town materials, and books and miscellanea. The series are divided topically into sections.
The Photographic Materials series is comprised of photographs, photo negatives, slides and tintypes of various Cornwall residents, locations, and events.
The materials in the People series include biographical and genealogical information on various Cornwall residents.
The Town Materials series is comprised of town meeting minutes and annual reports.
The Books and Miscellanea series includes text books, children's books, and religious books.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged topically and then alphabetically and chronologically within each topic.
The files are grouped into 4 series:

did.unittitle: Marsh Carriage House/ Cornwall Historical Society

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the former Marsh carriage house on Pine Street. The structure originally belonged to J.T. Andrews and was purchased by the Marsh family circa 1890. The building was converted into the residence of town historian Emily E. Marsh in 1954 and opened as the new home of the Cornwall Historical Society in 1967. Specific images include J.T. Andrews posing in front of his barn, as well as photos of the building when it served as both a private residence and as the historical society.

odd.p: Photograph of a barn built by Noah Harrison. Harrison was a Revolutionary War veteran and the first member of the Harrison family to settle in Cornwall.

odd.p: Photographs of an auto garage and filling station operated by the Hurlburt family. The building was torn down in 1940.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Palmer Mill. Images include the mill in operation and mill workers.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the Prentice Barn along Lake Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the Roberts Place on Great Hollow Road. The photo was given to the Cornwall Library in November 1943.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of various properties along Hautboy Hill Road. Specific images include a photo of the birthplace of Major General John Sedgwick.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Two photos of the C.P. Smith House along Hautboy Hill Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Two photos of the Carl Van Doren House on Cream Hill Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Two photographs of the Mark Van Doren House on Bradford Hill Road, one of which was taken by Emily E. Marsh.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the balancing boulders in Johnson Hollow, estimated to weigh approximately 100 tons.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Hurlburt family carriage house along Hurlburt Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Italiante style home of General John Sedgwick (1813-1864). The home is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Two photographs of an unidentified home along Ford Hill Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of unidentified properties along Lake Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of unidentified homes along Route 43, as well as images of the Sedgwick Monument.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of several unlabeled properties in Cornwall Hollow, as well as one image of lumber along the "Road by the Lake."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the former Fox family home. The house burned at an unknown date.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the "Waterfall at the Glen" taken by Mrs. John C. Kendall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the 'Waterfall at the Glen" taken by Mrs. John C. Kendall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of two post offices that stood in West Cornwall, including the current structure and an older building that is no longer extant.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the J. Mallinson Shear Company factory that stood along Lower River Road. Images include photos of the factory from various angles, as well as factory workers.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the West Cornwall Chapel. Photos include images of the building's interior and exterior.

did.unittitle: The Bee Hive/ F.J. Bate Meat Market

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the building in West Cornwall that functioned first as a social hall known as the Bee Hive, and then later as Bate's Meat Market.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Patrick "Cap" O'Donnell House. The home was built in the 1870s and is alternately known as the "Rock Cottage."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the F.A. Yutzler House on River Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Two photographs a mine owned by the Eureka Mining Company. The company was based in Trenton, New Jersey and sought to extract feldspar from a deposit located about a half mile south of West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Tarradiddle Farm in West Cornwall. Images include photos of the farm house and greenhouse.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the building along Railroad Street currently known as the Wish House. There are photos of the structure, which dates to the 1840s, as both the Wish House and the private dwelling of the Sturges family.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the home formerly owned by Michael Gannett on River Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of various properties along River Road and Lower River Road. Specified houses include those owned by the Marsh, Flint, Gagnier, Opley, Fowler, and Weaton families. There are also images of the Estee Rubber Factory, which burned in the 1920s, Ian Ingersoll's Cabinetmaking Shop, and the home and forge owned by blacksmith William Oliver. There are additionally two photos of the railroad tracks in the area.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Italiante style home originally owned by the Foster family. The building, also known as the "Pink House," later served as an inn.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the store located along the Sharon-Goshen Turnpike formerly run by the Yutzler family. There are images of both the interior and exterior of the building, and of members of the Yutzler family working in the store.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the St. Agnes Chapel located on the grounds of the Trinity Conference Center on Lower River Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of two stores along the Sharon-Goshen Turnpike owned by the Sturges family. There is one image of a store run by Theo Sturges, which sold tin, plumbing, and heating accessories and was located across the street from the former Catholic church currently owned by Bain Real Estate. There are two photos of Sturges & Son, a general store that was located in the building currently occupied by Cornwall Bridge Pottery.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of various buildings along Route 7. Specified images include properties owned by the Doolitte, Preston, Graham, Bates, Cochrane, and Schnider families. There are also several photos of the Housatonic Inn and of the construction of the route itself.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the West Cornwall fire house and ambulance barn. The fire house was built in 1932 by Lawrence Sturges.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the garage along Route 7 operated by Edward Cartwright. The brick structure was built circa 1915 and served as both a filling station and automobile dealership.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the West Cornwall Covered Bridge taken from the frontal view.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the West Cornwall Covered Bridge taken from various side views.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of a team of horses and wagon crossing the covered bridge.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Aerial views of the West Cornwall Covered Bridge

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the interior of the West Cornwall Covered Bridge taken by Don Henry.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of maintenance work done on the West Cornwall Covered Bridge.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of maintenance work done on the West Cornwall Covered Bridge.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Covered Bridge Building and Hardware, a business that operated out of the building currently occupied by Covered Bridge Pottery. Images include photos of the interior and exterior of the store as well as a group photo of Fitz Bruhel, Catherine Palmer, Al Storrs, and C.S. Smith.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Nineteenth-century photographs of the Housatonic River. There are images of the surrounding countryside and of the dam built by the Mallinson shear shop.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Reproduced photos of the Housatonic River, including images of the "old dam" belonging to the Mallinson company.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the Housatonic River taken by George H. Beck.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of people taking part in various recreational activities along the Housatonic River. There are images of kayakers and fisherman, and and of picnickers surveying the wreckage of the "Kaolin Bridge."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Housatonic River taken during the twentieth century, as well as modern reproductions of older images. There are images of the river and the surrounding area and of the dam from the Mallinson shear shop.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the West Cornwall Train Station. Photos include images of the station, trains, and passengers.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the plaza near the railroad station. Specific images include photos of a hardware store, decorating shop, studio, and dress shop. One photo is addressed to Hattie Sandmeyer from Edna Beck.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of various landscapes in West Cornwall. Specific images include a view from Dibble Hill and a photo of the hill behind Yutzler's store.

did.unittitle: Brown's Package Store/ The Wandering Moose

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the building at the corner of Route 128 and Lower River Road. The building, formerly known as "The Emporium," has housed businesses such as Brown's Package Store and the Wandering Moose.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the home formerly owned by Frank Whitney, located on "Fog Alley."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the bungalow first owned by E.G. Bishop, and then later by the Richardson family. The home stood near "the bend" of the Housatonic River, but is no longer extant.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the village of West Cornwall taken from various high elevations. There are photos taken from the Sharon side of the Housatonic River and from within West Cornwall itself.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the section of Route 128 that passes through the village of West Cornwall. Photos include images of the road itself, as well as various homes and businesses along its route. Specific images include photos of The Deck, Brookside Bistro, the old West Cornwall Fire House, and the Joe Lush House.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Route 128 outside the bounds of the village of West Cornwall. Photos include both images of the road itself, as well as structures along its route. Specified buildings include the Billbee Hills Farm, the Terhune House, and a home owned by George Dibble, and then later by Phil Bishop.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the building formerly used as a Roman Catholic Church in West Cornwall. The parish later moved to St. Bridget's Church in Cornwall Bridge and the building is currently owned by Bain Real Estate.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the old toll house near the West Cornwall Covered Bridge. The building currently houses Ian Ingersoll Cabinetmakers.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the bookstore in West Cornwall. The shop was owned by Martin and Gold at one time, and is currently operated by Barbara Farnsworth.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Mansion House Hotel. The building stood near the site of the current post office and was destroyed by fire in November 1924. Photos include images of the building during its heyday and the aftermath of the fire.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Trinity Conference Center on Lower River Road. One photo shows Wendy and John Denn, managers of the property, and another depicts the building known as "Yellow Camp" that was once the home of Joseph Mallinson, founder of the shear-making company that was located nearby.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of various unlabeled buildings in West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the former Masonic Hall in West Cornwall. The building was built in 1901 and later housed the business of Martin and Gold and Barbara Farnsworth.

did.unittitle: Cornwall Bridge Pottery/ Smith and Sons

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the multipurpose building in West Cornwall just to the east of the railroad tracks. The building was constructed in the mid-nineteenth century and originally functioned as a general store run by Pratt and Foster. Photos depict the business when it was operated by Smith and Sons and by Cornwall Bridge Pottery.

did.unittitle: Cornwall Bridge Pottery Album: Part I

odd.head: General
odd.p: The first part of a photo album showing the work down at the Cornwall Bridge Pottery.

did.unittitle: Cornwall Bridge Pottery Album: Part II

odd.head: General
odd.p: The second section of a photo album devoted to Cornwall Bridge Pottery.

did.unittitle: Cornwall Bridge Pottery Album: Part III

odd.head: General
odd.p: The final part of a photo album showing the work done at Cornwall Bridge Pottery.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the general store run by Cochrane Brothers. The building later became The Deck restaurant.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of people posing in front of the Cochrane Bros. Store.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of miscellaneous buildings and events in West Cornwall. Specific images include homes owned by Oliver Hart, Joann Beeman, N. Young, Denny Curtis, Everett Cole, and Mary Smith. There are also photographs of a Standard Oil delivery wagon, the parsonage building, and the pickup truck owned by the D and S Building Co. An image of a frozen water main break is also included.

odd.p: Stereoscopic views of the Foster House in West Cornwall.

odd.p: Photographs of the Mallinson Shear Shop taken from across the Housatonic River in Sharon.

odd.p: Photographs of the O'Donnell House in West Cornwall.

odd.p: Stereoscopic views of the tailor shop in West Cornwall operated by the Yutzler family.

odd.p: Stereoscopic views of the staff from the drug store run by the Porter family.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Stereoscopic views of River Road in West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Stereoscopic views of various landscapes in West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Stereoscopic view of the District 15 School, with the teacher and class, on Lower River Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Assorted black and white photographs of the covered bridge.

odd.p: Photograph of the rotary on Main Street.

odd.p: Photograph of the Cartwright family home.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the Fred Bate home.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the home owned by Nellie Handlin.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the Russell property, across the brook from the Yutzler property.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Aerial view of West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of various Cornwall landscapes, including ice-cutting on Winchell's Pond and the view from the Rexford family home.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of unlabeled Cornwall buildings.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of non-Cornwall buildings, including the Hartford Trust Company building in Hartford after the Blizzard of 1888, the Stone residence in Warren, the Emmons farm in Morris, and the Palmer house in Goshen.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of an unidentified home.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Samuel Adams donated by Mrs. Walter Swan. Adams was deacon in the Cornwall Baptist Church and married to Julia Hurburt. He is buried in West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Alanson Allen.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of the Allason family. Members include Anna, Ed, Nellie, Lilian, and Harry Allason.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Andrews family. Many photos are of John T. Andrews, who lived on Pine Street with his wife Jane Jones Andrews. An image of Jane is also present, along with one of John with his three brothers.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Cornwall Baldwin family. Specific members depicted are: Reverend Ebenezer Baldwin, T. Robert Baldwin, Edward R. Baldwin, and Professor Edward C. Baldwin.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Fred Bate, Jr. Photos include an image of Bate as a young man in his U.S. Army uniform and later as the honorary grand marshall of a parade.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Levi Beebe, the father of Cornelia Bradford.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Beeman family. In one photo, Sherman Beeman is posing on top of a wagon full of hay, and in the other, Esther R. Beeman is seen reading with a cat.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Behn family. The photos show blacksmith Donald Behn at work at his shop in Cornwall Bridge.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Dr. Abel Carter Benedict (1837-1898). The Bethel, Conn. native studied medicine at Yale before serving in the Union Army. He is buried in Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Edna Bragan posing near a picket fence.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Blake family. Images include photos of James Blake (1825-1916), an East Cornwall farmer, and his descendants. Specific descendants include his son Charles and granddaughter Marian. There are also photographs of Eddie Blake, who died after falling out of a school house window, and of Bessie Root Blake shopping in Cochrane's Store.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Cornwall resident Gerry Blakey.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Colonel Charles D. Blinn, who served in the 13th Connecticut Volunteer Regiment during the Civil War.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Bradford family. Specific family members include Fowler Bradford and Charlotte Belden Bradford, Cornelia Bradford, Louisa Bradford Fox, James Fitch Bradford, and John Bradford.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Polaroid photograph of Earl Brecher.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Breen family. Specific family members include John Breen and William H. Breen, who owned a general store in Cornwall Bridge.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Edward Everett Brewster.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of the Brown family. Specific family members include siblings Quincy Brown, Hattie Brown Humphrey, Abbie Brown Phelps, Mary Lydia Brown Clark, and Lottie Brown.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the artist Fritz Bruehl and several of his works. Bruehl was the staff artist at Trinity.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Bunnell family. Specific family members include Oscar and Bertha Bunnell with their four daughters, and Belle Kellogg Bunnell.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of G.H. Burgraff.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Calhoun family. Specific family members include Mr. and Mrs. John E. Calhoun and Jean Calhoun Bacon. Photos also include images of the Calhoun farm in Cornwall Plain, including the farm house, which burnt down in 1911 and was rebuilt in 1912.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Glass plate negatives from family photographs of the Calhoun family.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Bertie Cartwright walking through West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Lillie Catlin.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of life on the Oliver Chipman farm.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Harriet L. Clark. Clark was active in both state politics and in the Cornwall Historical Society. Images of Clark include photos of both her political and personal life.

did.unittitle: Harriet L. Clark with Hooked Rug

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Harriet L. Clark with a prize-winning hooked rug.

did.unittitle: Harriet L. Clark and Sasha Clark

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Harriet L. Clark with Sasha Clark.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Close-up photograph of Sasha Clark.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Clark family of East Cornwall. Specific family members include Sheldon Clark, L. Clark, William L. Clark, William B. Clark, Ernest Dwight Clark, Lydia Brown Clark, Loyal Brown Clark, Melissa Clark, and Charlotte Clark.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Lottie Clark.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Cochrane family. Specific family members include Miner Cochrane, Jessie Rogers Cochrane, H.G. Cochrane, and J.G. Cochrane.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the Cochrane family posing outside their home in West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Henry Cole.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Corban family. One image depicts Mryon Corban in a wagon full of hay and the other shows unspecified Corban children posed in front of their home.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of George Corban taken by Armin Landeck.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Crosby family. Specific family members are Katherine Salenski Crosby and her husband George Crosby. One series of photos depicts George Crosby building a bookshelf, and another shows a boating trip.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Methodist Chaplain Charles Dixon and of Jack Dixon with a team of horses.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Elizabeth Dudley Hyde (1861-1951). Hyde was the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lafayette Dudley, who were Cornwall residents, but she herself spent her life in New York and Ohio.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of the Ellingwood family. Woolsey Ellingwood, Martorie Ellingwood, and John E. Calhoun are shown sitting with Ellingwood grandchildren.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Lewis Emmons, half-brother of Milton Emmons.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Engisch family. Photos include Walter Engisch in his military uniform and posed with George Engisch in front of their store in Cornwall Bridge. There are also a collection of personal photos formerly belonging to Mabel Engisch, including images related to her teaching career and of her with Joseph McArthur.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Neil Estern.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Ed Ferman.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Dr. Edward Foot and his family. Many of the photos depict life on the family farm.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portraits of members of the extended Ford family. Specified members of the family are Charles Ford, W. Dakin, Dr. and Mrs. W.E. Knibloe, and Will Calendar.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portraits of extended Ford family members. Specified individuals are Harold Ford, Clinton Goodale, and Leo Dean.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Small portraits of members of the extended Ford family. Identified family members are George W. Ford, Emma Ford, Alice Dakin, Mr. and Mrs. Cole, Mrs. C. E. Baldwin, and Grace Baldwin.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Stephen Foster. Foster was co-owner of the West Cornwall business Pratt and Foster.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Gannett family. Included in the collection are photos of Lewis and Ruth Gannett, as well as photographs of Michael Gannett.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of the Gannett House.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Ruth Gannett's gardens.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Judith Gates and of actor Larry Gates with Rose Algrant.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Helen Gazagnaire.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Jill Gibbons.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Gold family. Specific members include Thedore S. Gold, S.W. Gold, Phebe C. Gold, Samuel F. Gold of New Jersey, Egbert H. Gold of Chicago.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Florance Gomez.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Robert Graham dousing for water in Dudleytown.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Leila Beatrice Gregory at age three.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of two Hallock children.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Harrison family. There is a series of photos depicting the family of George Chandler Harrison (1840-1907) at their home, Plainview, taken from 1911-1913. There are also photos of Marian Louise Harrison, John R. Harrison, Eleanor Bradford Harrison, Myron Harrison, and a portrait of George Chandler Harrison during his time as a state legislator.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Hart family. One collection of photos is from the "Hart Calendar" and shows scenes from the Hart farm. Other photos include portraits of Rev. John Clark Hart, E. Burton Hart, and Rep. Nathan Hart, as well as a portrait of Oliver, Betsy, and Martha Hart.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Hart family. Photos include a portrait of Charles and Nellie Hart, a group photograph of the Hart, Hedden, and O'Donnell families, as well as images of Doug Hart, Ethel and Olive Hart, Leroy Hart, Wallace Hart, Amy Hart, Oliver Hart, and Alden Hart.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Maureen Hawes.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Hewett family. Photos include a portrait of Mary Hewett, Harrison Hewett,and Kate Harrison Hewett sitting on their front porch, and images of Kate Harrison Hewett at her spinning wheel.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Reverend Hoppin, pastor of the North Cornwall Meeting House.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Abner A. Horner sitting in his study. Horner was a member of the Lafayette College Class of 1911.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Ives family. Images include photos of the Ives family farm copied from the photo album of Lucy Ives, as well as a portrait of Lucy May Ives as an infant.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portraits of Mr. and Mrs. Almon James.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Judson family. Images include a photo of Lillian Beach, Mrs. Judson, Mrs. Jessop, and Mary Jessop Beach. There is also a photo showing the interior of the Judson home.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of W.B. Hubbard

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Horace Hitchcock.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Dr. Hodge, who practiced in Cornwall Bridge.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Kellogg family. Many of the images are of Bessie Kellogg, a teacher who was the daughter of Philo Kellogg and Elizabeth Chipman of East Cornwall. There are also photos of Philo Kellogg and his wife Elizabeth Chipman, and of the Kellogg home.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Waller Kilhamson taking part in a parade with a banner celebrating his "resettlement" of Dudleytown.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of George Kittle.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Elizabeth Lansing.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of fire chief Joseph Lush, Jr. receiving the key to the new fire house from Cornwall First Selectman Kenneth A. Merz.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of G. Leo Listman of West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Joseph and Maggie Mallinson. Mallinson was the owner of the shear shop on Lower River Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Bea and Fred Marchionna.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Marsh family. Included are photos of E.W. Marsh and his immediate family, Charles C. Marsh and his daughter Marian Louise Marsh Corban, Mr. and Mrs. Cyrus Marsh, and many images of town librarian Emily E. Marsh.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Personal photograph collection of Emily E. Marsh. Marsh grew up on Pine Street and was well known in the community as a librarian, historian, and church organist. Her photos include images of social events featuring friends and family members like Fanny Baldwin, Mrs. McGaw, Elizabeth Wilcox, and Marian Marsh, as well as her family dog, Pearl.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of extended members of the Marsh family collected by Emily E. Marsh. There are photos of Marsh family members from Rockford, Illinois and Lakewood, Ohio, as well as a photo of Catie Marsh of Washington, D.C.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Cornwall postmaster and artist Clarence P. Meier. There are photos of Meier's murals as well as Meier working at a potter's wheel.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of the Reverend Oscar Garland McIntire.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Reverend Henry B. Mead (1839-1903). Mead, a New Hampshire native, was a Congregationalist minister who served Cornwall for a brief period of ttime.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Miller family. The Millers were interrelated to several Cornwall families, such as the Mallinsons and Yutzlers. There are photos of Francis Miller, Freddy Miller, Mary Miller Yutzler, Joseph Charles Miller, Margaret Miller Mallinson, and Louise Miller Mallinson. There is also a family photo taken in Abraham Mallinson's East Haven home showing three generations of the Miller-Mallinson-Yutzler family.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Leigh Richmond Miner (1852-1935) and family. Miner was born in Cornwall to George Lewellyn Miner and Eliza Guild and taught at the Hampton Institute in Virginia.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of James Henry Moser and his art supplies. A copy of a photo owned by Moser's descendants depicts Moser in his rain gear, and two additional images show his easle and studio sign.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Reverend J. Nelson. Nelson was pastor of the Methodist Episcopal Church at Cornwall Center.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Judge Leonard J. Nickerson.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Hazel and Mildred Niles in West Cornwall with Alice Horner Russell and Effie Whitney Catelino.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Phyllis Wojan.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photograph of Patrick "Cap" O'Donnell of West Cornwall with Jay Rowe and Lucas Richmond.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Oliver family of West Cornwall. Many of the photos are of blacksmith William Oliver. There are images of Oliver working at his shop, as well as in formal attire and with his family. There is also a portrait of Ethel Oliver.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Oviatt family. Many of the photos are of Ed Oviatt, but there are also images of Dell Oviatt, E.W. Oviatt, Will Oviatt, Nellie Oviatt, George Oviatt, and Sybil Oviatt. Additionally, there are photos of Frances B.O. Hubbard, the Oviatt home, and Punch the dog.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of B.C. Patterson taken on the occasion of his 88th birthday.

odd.p: Photographs of the Payne family. Two of the images are portraits of Sgt. Joseph Benjamin Payne, son of Rufus and Polly Calhoun Payne, who was killed at the Battle of Cold Harbor during the Civil War. The other photo depicts Mike Payne as part of a railroad repair crew with Bill Dinneen, Senior.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Perkins family. One photo shows Clifford Perkins training a pair of steers, and the other shows Mr. and Mrs. Robert Perkins with their family on their 50th wedding anniversary.

odd.p: Photographs of Larry Pool at a formal dinner.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Pratt family. One photo is a portrait of West Cornwall businessman Russell R. Pratt, and the other shows the Pratt family taking a wagon to church.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Prentice family photographs. There is a collection of photos taken of artwork by the Prentice family, as well as a photo of the Tim and Marie Prentice House. Additionally, there is a picture of Maureen Cole Prentice at the Cornwall Observation Post.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Esther G. Rogers. The collection includes photos of Rogers as an infant, through childhood, and into adulthood. One image depicts four generations of Rogers' family, including Artemesia Wheaton, Mrs. James A. Cochrane, Jessie C. Rogers, and Esther.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of James Cochrane Rogers. Photos include images of Rogers as a child through adulthood. Many of the pictures show Rogers working on his farm or with his family.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Jessie Cochrane Rogers. Photos include portraits and an image of Jessie with her husband Miner P. Rogers.

odd.head: General
odd.p: General photographs of the Rogers family and their farm. There are photos of Colonel Anson Rogers, Principal Ambrose S. Rogers, Justice Edward Rogers, Daniel L. Rogers, Julia Emeline Corban Rogers, Nellie L. Rogers, Harriet F. Rogers, Louise, Charles, and Estelle Rogers, Olive Rogers, Charlie Rogers, and Edward Rogers.

odd.p: Photographs of Mary Schefflien practicing music with a group of students, including Jan Walker.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Louis H. Schutte. Schutte was the headmaster of the Rumsey Hall School and lived in Cornwall for nearly fifty years before his death in April 1957.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Vincenzo Rondinone. Rondinone was a skilled potter and worked at the pottery on the Castle property owned by Dr. and Mrs. Martin. Many of the photos show Rondinone at work in the pottery, and one depicts him with his son Nicholas and a team of oxen. The images in this collection were donated by Nicholas Rondinone.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Sandford family. Photos include images of Helen Sandford Tankersly, L. Sandford, and Mrs. T. R. Sandford, as well as Evelyn Smith.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Scoville family and their farm. Photos include images of Jacob Scoville and Samuel Scoville and scenes of various work being done on the farm, such as snow plowing and sap collecting.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portraits of Representative Elbert Shepard and Representative Eliphalet H. Shepard.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Smith family. One photo depicts George and David Smith on the front porch of their home, while another picture shows Mrs. Fred Smith with her children. There is also a portrait of Hon. David L. Smith (1843-1912), a senator, banker, and merchant of West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Portrait of Rev. Carl Stackman. Stackman was the pastor at the Second Congregational Church of Cornwall from July 1902-August 1904.

odd.head: General

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Carl Van Doren (1885-1950). Van Doren was a Pulitzer Prize-winning author and critic who also taught at his alma mater, Columbia University.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of Pulitzer Prize-winner Mark Van Doren (1894-1972) and his family. Van Doren was an influential writer, poet, and professor at Columbia University. Many of the photos show Mark Van Doren at his home in Cornwall. There are also photos of Dorothy Van Doren, Charles Van Doren, and John Van Doren.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Wadsworth family. There is a portrait of James Wadsworth, deacon of the North Cornwall Meeting House, and a picture of the grave of Samuel Wadsworth (1767-1817) in Canfield, Ohio.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Yutzler family. Multiple generations of Yutzlers operated a successful general store in West Cornwall. There a photos of Adam Yutzler, the first member of the family to settle in Cornwall, as well as many of his descendants, such as Frederick A. Yutzler, Harry Yutzler, Joseph Yutzler, Carl Yutzler, Frederick W. Yutzler, Blanch Yutzler, and "Dutch" Yutzler. There is also a photo of a painting by Arlington Yutzler and a group photograph sent to Florence Yutzler by her Sunday school class.
Additionally, there are several photographs of the general store in West Cornwall showing customers like Huldah O'Donnell, Fred Scoville, and an unnamed member of the Gold family.

odd.p: Photographs of the Adelphic Institute building on Town Street in North Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Cream Hill Agricultural School. The school, which was the first such institution in the United States, was located on the Gold family farm in North Cornwall and operated from 1845-1869. Today, the structure is under the care of the Connecticut Antique Machinery Association and is located in Kent, Conn. There is also a group photograph of students and teachers from 1859-1860.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Housatonic Valley Institute. There are photographs of the buildings and grounds, as well as various students and the school's football team.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Marvelwood School in Cornwall Plain. There are photos of the administration building, which was located in a home formerly owned by the Cochrane family, and of the Trustee House, which was located in a home once owned by Whiting Wilcox.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Rumsey Hall School in Cornwall Plain. There are photos of the exteriors and interiors of buildings associated with the school.

odd.head: General

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the Cornwall Consolidated School on Cream Hill Road. The building was designed by T. Merrill Prentice and built from 1939-1940. There are photos of the building's exterior and interior, as well as pictures documenting its construction.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs from the third school district located in Cornwall Center. There are photos of the school house, as well as a barn owned by Charles Osborne that was supposedly built from materials taken from the school after it was torn down.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs from the third school district, which was located in Johnson Hollow. There are photos of the school house, which was built in 1840 and torn down by the 1970s, as well as class photos.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs from the fifth school district, which was located in Cream Hill. The Queen Anne-style school house stood on Scoville Road and is currently a private residence. There are photos of the school house and of various students and teachers.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs from the sixth school district, which was located along Ford Road in Cornwall Hollow. There are photos of the school house as well as class pictures.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the District 7 school house located along Route 128. It is currently a private residence.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the interior and exterior of the District 8 school house, which was located in Cornwall Bridge.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the District 10 school house, which stood near Dudleytown Road.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the interior and exterior of the District 11 school house, which stood near West Cornwall.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs from the twelfth school district, which was located in North Cornwall. In 1922, the building became the private residence of William Bierce. There are photos of the school house and of students.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of the District 14 school house along Great Hollow Road. Today, the building is a private residence.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Photographs of students and teachers from the fifteenth school district in West Cornwall. Many of the photographs are class pictures.

odd.head: General

There are photos of the school house, as well as a picture of a monument dedicated to Henry Obukaha'ia in Hawaii, and a picture of a lantern that belonged to John Northrop, the steward of the school.
